title: Wild West Vocabulary
description: Saddle up and test your knowledge of frontier and cowboy language from the Old West

questions.question: In the Old West, what was a 'tenderfoot'?
What did 'vamoose' mean in Wild West slang?
In frontier language, what was a 'calaboose'?
What was a 'six-shooter' in the Old West?
options: A bartender who poured six drinks
A revolver that held six bullets

questions.question: In Wild West parlance, what did 'to belly up to the bar' mean?
options: To approach the bar to order a drink

questions.question: What was a 'bushwhacker' in the Old West?
In frontier slang, what did 'bamboozle' mean?
What was a 'claim jumper' in the Wild West?
options: Someone who illegally took over another's mining claim

questions.question: In Old West vocabulary, what was 'hardtack'?
options: A hard, dry biscuit or cracker

questions.question: What did 'to ride shotgun' originally mean?
options: To sit next to the stagecoach driver armed with a shotgun

questions.question: In the Old West, what was a 'maverick'?
options: An unbranded calf or independent-minded person

questions.question: What did 'high-tail it' mean in frontier slang?
In Wild West language, what was a 'sidewinder'?
options: A rattlesnake or a sneaky person

questions.question: What was a 'sodbuster' in the Old West?
options: A farmer who plowed the prairie

questions.question: In frontier slang, what was a 'greenhorn'?
